results.title: In Utero Exposure to Metformin Reduces the Fertility of Male Offspring in Adulthood
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ is also used in the treatment of @<m>DISEASE_Pregnancy_in_Diabetics</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011254 @@@pregnancy disorders@@@ such as @DISEASE_Diabetes_Gestational @DISEASE_MESH:D016640 @@@gestational diabetes@@@.

citations.NLM: Faure MC, Khoueiry R, Quanico J, Acloque H, Guerquin MJ, Bertoldo MJ, Chevaleyre C, Ramé C, Fournier I, Salzet M, Dupont J, Froment P.  In Utero Exposure to Metformin Reduces the Fertility of Male Offspring in Adulthood Front Endocrinol (Lausanne). 2021;12():750145. PMID: 34745014

results.title: Antenatal management and maternal/fetal outcomes associated with hyperglycaemia in pregnancy (HIP) in Uganda; a prospective cohort study
results.text_hl: @SPECIES_9606 @@@Women@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Pregnancy_in_Diabetics</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011254 @@@DIP@@@ were more likely to be treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ than the @DISEASE_Diabetes_Gestational @DISEASE_MESH:D016640 @@@GDM@@@ group (48.7% Vs 21.1), and at a higher dose.

citations.NLM: Milln J, Nakabuye B, Natamba BK, Sekitoleko I, Mubiru M, Namara AA, Tumwesigire S, Tino S, Mirembe M, Kakande A, Agaba B, Nansubuga F, Zaake D, Ayiko B, Kalema H, Nakubulwa S, Sekikubo M, Nakimuli A, Webb EL, Nyirenda MJ. Antenatal management and maternal/fetal outcomes associated with hyperglycaemia in pregnancy (HIP) in Uganda; a prospective cohort study BMC Pregnancy Childbirth. 2021 May 19;21(1):386. PMID: 34011299

results.title: Screening for hyperglycaemia in pregnancy: Consensus and controversy.
results.journal: Best Pract Res Clin Endocrinol Metab
results.text_hl: However the case for screening has been strengthened by a number of recent developments, including: rising prevalence of @<m>DISEASE_Pregnancy_in_Diabetics</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011254 @@@HGP@@@ because of increasing maternal age and BMI; the results of the Hyperglycaemia and Adverse Pregnancy Outcomes study, showing that adverse effects of @<m>DISEASE_Pregnancy_in_Diabetics</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011254 @@@HGP@@@ are seen over a wider range of plasma @CHEMICAL_Glucose @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005947 @@@glucose@@@ levels than previously thought; two large trials which showed the benefits of treating lesser degrees of @<m>DISEASE_Pregnancy_in_Diabetics</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011254 @@@HGP@@@; trials showing that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Glyburide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005905 @@@glibenclamide@@@ were effective and safe alternatives to immediate @GENE_INS @GENE_3630 @@@insulin@@@ in those without good control on lifestyle measures alone.

citations.NLM: Waugh N, Pearson D, Royle P. Screening for hyperglycaemia in pregnancy: Consensus and controversy. Best Pract Res Clin Endocrinol Metab. 2010 Aug;24(4):553-71. PMID: 20832736
citations.BibTeX: @article{20832736, title={Screening for hyperglycaemia in pregnancy: Consensus and controversy.}, author={Waugh N and Pearson D and Royle P}, journal={Best Pract Res Clin Endocrinol Metab}, volume={24}, number={4}, pages={553-71}}

authors: Northern Territory Diabetes in Pregnancy Partnership
results.text_hl: Real-world experience of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ use in pregnancy: Observational data from the Northern Territory @<m>DISEASE_Pregnancy_in_Diabetics</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011254 @@@Diabetes in Pregnancy@@@ Clinical Register.

results.title: Higher-order multiple pregnancy associated with metformin in women with polycystic ovary syndrome: two cases and review of the literature.
results.text_hl: Higher-order @<m>DISEASE_Pregnancy_in_Diabetics</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011254 @@@multiple pregnancy@@@ associated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ in @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@ with @DISEASE_Polycystic_Ovary_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D011085 @@@polycystic ovary syndrome@@@: two cases and review of the literature.

results.title: Combined metformin and clomiphene citrate versus highly purified FSH for ovulation induction in clomiphene-resistant PCOS women: a randomised controlled trial.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSIONS: Combined @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@-CC resulted in modest ovulation and @<m>DISEASE_Pregnancy_in_Diabetics</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011254 @@@pregnancy@@@ rates without side effects.

citations.NLM: Abu Hashim H, Wafa A, El Rakhawy M. Combined metformin and clomiphene citrate versus highly purified FSH for ovulation induction in clomiphene-resistant PCOS women: a randomised controlled trial. Gynecol Endocrinol. 2011 Mar;27(3):190-6. PMID: 20568955

results.title: Angiogenic Dysregulation in Pregnancy-Related Hypertension-A Role for Metformin.
results.text_hl: Dubbed as the new "@CHEMICAL_Aspirin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001241 @@@aspirin@@@" of current times, the retardation of the antiangiogenic status by @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ provides an exciting and promising alternate strategy in treating these @<m>DISEASE_Pregnancy_in_Diabetics</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011254 @@@pregnancy disorders@@@.

citations.NLM: Soobryan N, Murugesan S, Pandiyan A, Moodley J, Mackraj I. Angiogenic Dysregulation in Pregnancy-Related Hypertension-A Role for Metformin. Reprod Sci. 2018 Nov;25(11):1531-1539. PMID: 29739273

results.title: Natural selection? The evolution of diagnostic criteria for gestational diabetes.
results.text_hl: @DISEASE_Diabetes_Gestational @DISEASE_MESH:D016640 @@@Gestational diabetes@@@ is a common @<m>DISEASE_Pregnancy_in_Diabetics</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011254 @@@pregnancy disorder@@@ which is generally managed with diet, exercise, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ or @CHEMICAL_Insulin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007328 @@@insulin@@@ treatment and which usually resolves after delivery of the infant.

citations.NLM: Meek CL. Natural selection? The evolution of diagnostic criteria for gestational diabetes. Ann Clin Biochem. 2017 Jan;54(1):33-42. PMID: 27687080
citations.BibTeX: @article{27687080, title={Natural selection? The evolution of diagnostic criteria for gestational diabetes.}, author={Meek CL}, journal={Ann Clin Biochem}, volume={54}, number={1}, pages={33-42}}
